issues.description: The solution implementation declares attributes using snake_case names (e.g. "lecture_name", "number_of_inscribed_students") but the constructor, getters/setters and other methods use camelCase field names (e.g. "lectureName", "numberOfInscribedStudents"). The problem statement and UML also use camelCase names. This name mismatch inside the solution causes compilation errors and contradicts the intended attribute naming described in the specification, which will confuse students inspecting the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make attribute names in the solution match the camelCase names used in the UML and throughout the class. For example, declare: private String lectureName; private int numberOfInscribedStudents; private int numberOfGuestStudents; private int numberOfLecturers; private int numberOfTutors; and update any assignments/use-sites accordingly (or alternatively change all uses to snake_case consistently). Also update addGuestStudents to modify the field via this.numberOfGuestStudents += numberOfNewGuestStudents; Ensuring consistent names will restore compilation and align the solution with the problem statement.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML use camelCase attribute names (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors). The solution implementation declares the fields using snake_case (lecture_name, number_of_inscribed_students, number_of_guest_students, number_of_lecturers, number_of_tutors) but then uses camelCase identifiers (e.g. this.lectureName) in the constructor and methods. This creates a direct naming mismatch across artifacts and an internal inconsistency in the solution code itself. Students reading the problem/UML will expect camelCase fields; the solution's snake_case fields (and the resulting compile errors because the code references non-existent camelCase fields) create unnecessary cognitive load and hinder mapping problem requirements to the implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make identifier naming consistent across artifacts. Rename the fields declared in the solution to the camelCase names used in the problem/UML: lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors — and update all references (constructor, getters/setters, methods) to use these names. Alternatively (less recommended) update the problem/UML/template to use the snake_case names — but prefer aligning the solution to the problem's camelCase convention so students can map requirements to implementation without confusion.
